page.title: 06Concern About Traffic
page.content: Concern was shown about the state of disrepair of roads in East Grinstead. More traffic lights, pedestrian & school crossings, footbridges, cycle paths and one way systems, as well as new priorities at roundabouts and improved junctions were thought necessary.People were also worried about lorries, and the inability of both the road system and the new by pass to cope with problems which arise. The idea of a more effective road system to completely by pass the town was popular whilst views about widening the pavement and narrowing of London Road were also added to the questionaire by a very large proportion of the parents indicating widespread concern for both drivers and pedestrians, particularly, the elderly in winter.
